Simple.name: Question
Simple.value: EAMON CS 1.6 GENERAL HELP.

1. Commands may be abbreviated on the left or right side. Examples: "A DR" or "A GON" for ATTACK DRAGON, "REQ RAY FROM AL" or "REQ GUN FROM IEN" for REQUEST RAY GUN FROM ALIEN, "PUT PUM IN LAR" or "PUT PIE IN OVEN" for PUT PUMPKIN PIE IN **021

2. Sometimes items may be in a room but won't show up until you EXAMINE them. Pay close attention to all descriptions. Note: LOOK only repeats the room description and -nothing- else. Use EXAMINE to, well, examine things. **022

3. Before you can manipulate items that are inside of, under or behind other items, you must REMOVE them from that item. There is no REMOVE ALL command, but if you ATTACK a (breakable) container, all of its contents will be emptied to the **023

4. Type SAVE and a number for a desired save position to Quick Save (save without having to verify). Adding a description will rename that slot. Examples: "SAVE 2" or "SAVE 5 Dark Room (NO GRUES)". Also works with RESTORE. (Type RESTORE 1, etc.)

5. You can INVENTORY companions (normally anyone whom, when you SMILE, smiles back at you) to see what they are carrying and wearing. You can then REQUEST those items from them. You can also INVENTORY certain containers to get a list of contents.
6. If you GIVE food or a beverage to a friend, they will take a bite or drink and give it back to you.

7. To give money to someone, type GIVE and an amount. For example, GIVE 1000 TO IRS AGENT would pay 1000 gold coins to the nice IRS Agent. In most standard adventures, if you GIVE 5000 or more, a neutral monster will -usually- become your friend.
8. The POWER spell has been known to have strange and marvelous effects in many adventures. When all else fails (or just for fun) try POWER.

Simple.name: Question
Simple.value: EAMON CS 1.6 NEW COMMANDS.
1. The GO command allows you to travel through any door/gate you encounter, including those that are free-standing (not associated with a room directional link).

2. The SETTINGS command allows you to change a variety of configuration options, which are persisted across saved games. The settings available and their effects on gameplay can vary between adventures, so trying this command is usually helpful.

3. The LOOK, EXAMINE, REMOVE and PUT commands have been enhanced to work with prepositions. You can LOOK or EXAMINE [in|on|under|behind] [container] to get a list of contents and then REMOVE or PUT [item] [in|on|under|behind] [container] **024

Simple.name: Question
Simple.value: Beginner's Forest -- Help! There are too many spooks!

1. The ten cardboard cut-out "spooks" that will come after you in part of this adventure can be a little unfair for beginning level characters. If you wish, you can reduce the total amount of spooks to two if you SAY LESS SPOOKS.

Simple.name: Question
Simple.value: Secrets of the Beginner's Forest. (For your amusement...)

SPOILER ALERT! The following contains a complete list of all the special things you can do which are unique to this adventure. This will also spoil any surprises if you are still exploring. Only read ahead if you are sure you want everything revealed.

In the Beginner's Forest you can: Get different results from the Ranger if you are a beginner, are not a beginner, or forget to bring at least one weapon; Get different results from the Fairy Queen depending upon your gender;

...Get a magic sword from the Fairy Queen if you are carrying the blade of grass (or it is in the room) when you first meet her; Sir Grummor will always be initially friendly if your character is female (75% chance of friendliness for male characters);

...WEAR the ring to activate a SPEED spell (note: the ring vanishes when the spell wears off); Automatically get resurrected and placed at the entrance if you step into the unfair death traps that were in the original version of the Beginner's Forest;
...Find a secret bridge if you EXAMINE SHAPE at the top of the oak tree; end up at the entrance with the path to the Beginner's Forest gone if you go west from the beaver dam.
